DataElement.preferredName: Patient Concomitant Or Prior Invasive Malignant Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to a person's concurrent malignancies, if any

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Concomitant Or Prior Invasive Malignant Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Earlier in time or order._Cancer that has spread beyond the layer of tissue in which it developed and is growing into surrounding, healthy tissues._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Concomitant Or Prior Invasive Malignant Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Earlier in time or order.:Cancer that has spread beyond the layer of tissue in which it developed and is growing into surrounding, healthy tissues.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Cancer that has spread beyond the layer of tissue in which it developed and is growing into surrounding, healthy tissues.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have another
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have another concurrent active invasive malignancy (except non-melanomatous skin cancer)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of invasive malignancy

ReferenceDocuments.name: EAE161
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have another active (within past 3 years) or concurrent malignancy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any active malignancy within 2 years of registration that may alter the course of esophageal cancer treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have concomitant invasive malignancy or a history of other invasive malignancies, with the exception of non-melanoma skin cancer within the past five years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any concurrent or prior invasive malignancy whose natural history or treatment have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any concurrent or prior malignancy whose natural history or treatment does not  have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known active or history of invasive non-CNS primary cancer based on documented pathologic diagnosis within the past 3 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been treated for a prior invasive breast malignancy?
